conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine the acceleration during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds.
Identify the velocity-time graph with velocity on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis.
Determine the velocity at different points: 2 m/s at 1 second, 0 m/s at 2 seconds, -2 m/s at 3 seconds.
Use the formula for acceleration: a = Δv/Δt.
Velocity changes from 2 m/s to 0 m/s and then to -2 m/s.
Calculate acceleration from 2 m/s to 0 m/s: (0 - 2)/1 = -2 m/s².
Calculate acceleration from 0 m/s to -2 m/s: (-2 - 0)/(3 - 2) = -2 m/s².
Acceleration is constant during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds.
Acceleration during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds is -2 m/s².
